name: Brown's Wharf Inn

reviews.text: Boothbay Harbor was recommended to us by friends as a place we should visit while in Maine. I found Brown's Wharf Inn through Tripadvisor. Both were terrific finds. The room was clean and comfortable and despite the huge yacht that was moored at the wharf and visible outside of our room blocking the views we loved our stay at the Inn. Our only complaint was that although the rooms are all nonsmoking, the balconies are not and we had to close our door and turn on the airconditioner despite the pleasant evening because of our neighbor smoking cigars on the balcony and it was floating into our room. On our whalewatching tour we learned that many celebrities choose Brown's to stay at when they visit Boothbay, we certainly will again as well.
reviews.title: Beautiful Views of the Harbor

likes.disliked: — Getting to town required a walk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed at Brown's Wharf several times and always find it to be spotless and beautiful. The owner takes great care to ensure that the flowers adorning the property are healthy and well appointed. Sitting on the balcony of a water-view room is so relaxing. The foot-bridge into town is very close. Food is fabulous - breakfast as well as dinner; dine inside or out. Always free coffee and newspapers each morning in the common area - very family oriented. A plus is that it is right next to the lobster co-op which has the BEST lobster rolls in Maine! Try Brown's Wharf - you'll be back!
reviews.title: Very clean and warm

likes.liked: — Family owned and quality of food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from our stay at Brown's Wharf and we are still talking about it. We stayed in a room on the second floor on the side of the hotel. We had a large balcony with three chairs and an excellent view of the harbor. We were situated right over the water. The view was great.
reviews.title: Loved Brown's Wharf

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was large with a king size bed. The entire property was spotless. In fact my wife described it as "sparkling". There was a small refrigerator in the room.
reviews.title: Nice Value and Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The dining room was closed the evening we were at the hotel(Tuesdays), however we were only about 200 yards from the Boothbay Harbor Lobster Pound (Best lobster we had on our trip through Maine - not fancy, just lobster steamed and served on picnic tables overlooking the harbor).
reviews.title: Great place to stay!
Wonderful relaxing weekend at Brown's Wharf Inn
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a weekend at Brown's Wharf Inn where we had gone with 2 other couples. We all had third floor rooms, all next to each other, overlooking the harbor. We relaxed out on the balcony watching the boats coming in and out of the harbor. The rooms were very clean, the beds very comfortable, and the staff was great. The grounds were beautiful and very well maintained with beautiful flowers all over the property. We ate dinner in their restaurant the first night and ate breakfast there both mornings and all enjoyed our meals. We had a great, relaxing weekend, would definitely go back, and would recommend staying here.

reviews.title: Plain, Older, Basic But What A View!
reviews.text: Don't expect modern, twenty-first century like rooms with lots of upgrades -- this is a basic motel maybe a little over-priced but you are paying for the location and the lovely view of Boothbay Harbor, Maine -- atnight with the lights it looks like a Christmas village and during the day activity on the water is entertaining. Room was on 3rd floor, had a balcony and was roomy with a small fridge and coffee maker -- very convenient. Clean but modest bathroom with shower and tub -- towels were thin and could have used more than 2 bath and hand towels -- so thin one use and they were permanently wet! Bed was comfortable and AC did work nicely. Carpeting needs to be cleaned BADLY or replaced-- bottom of white socks I had are now forever dark despite washing!!!--don't walk barefoot!.

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.text: Restaurant was traditional but food was welll prepared. However, for the price of the room ($202 with tax!) they could have provided a complimentary continental breakfast for guests only -- but then again this is Boothbay Harbor....Free trolley to downtown Boothbay shopping if the 3/4 mile walk in is too much for you. Front desk staff was exceptional and efficient and a positive addition to an average motel. Charles Karault recommendation no longer seems current -- step out of the time warp and maybe fix things up a bit.

reviews.title: The Good, The Bad, & The Ugly
reviews.text: We arrived at the Brown's Wharf Inn on July 23 and stayed 2 nights. The checkin was very easy and the staff were very friendly. Upon entering the room, we were disappointed. The bathroom was so small that barely only one person could fit in it. A larger person would definitely have difficulty manuevering in this tiny bathroom. This made it difficult to assist my young son with his shower.

reviews.title: Good to be back at Brown's
reviews.text: I found the room to be very outdated and in need of renovation. It seemd to me as though the hotel was looking for the cheapest ways possible to run a hotel. The carpet was very rough and thin; I believe it was indoor/outdoor carpeting. The blankets in our room (and my parent's room) had holes in them. The sheets were stained. We were supplied with only two sets of towels. I use two towels myself when I take a shower! I have never stayed in hotel that only gave two towels per room! When soap/shampoo were used they were not replenished.

This is a great place for families! The staff is friendly and accomodating, the room was spacious and clean, the view from the room was lovely, and the property is very well-maintained. And the rates are very reasonable.
reviews.title: Great family place in Boothbay Harbor

reviews.text: My husband and I along with our adult daughter and our 12 yr old son made our first trip to New England this month. We all loved BoothBay Harbor . The Inn is wonderful! The cleanest I have ever seen and the staff were friendly and helpful. We took advantage of the wonderful continental breakfast in the restaurant and it was great too. The views are breathtaking, I would recommend checking out the web cam. It does not do it justice but it will give you and idea of the great views. I would not stay anywhere else in Boothbay!!! The town is friendly and has some great shops and restaurants.
reviews.title: Wonderful Inn in a wonderful town
Charming and relaxing
reviews.text: Checked reviews on trip advisor about this motel. They were all right! This is a very clean family run motel. Very relaxing and charming. The rooms were very clean and all had a great view of the harbor. We stayed on the cove side and it was very quiet. I would definitely stay on this side again. Breakfast was good. I will definitley be back when I need some R&R.

Second visit in two years. Rooms are comfortable and clean. Each room has a balcony that looks out over the harbor. You are so close to the water, you need to bring your Dramamine! Hotel has a nice lounge, an inviting restaurant, and places to sit and watch the boats go by. My only regret is that we had only one night to spend at Browns Wharf this year. The family makes you feel welcome from check in to check out. They've earned their #1 rating on tripadvisor.
reviews.title: Great views of the harbor from every room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited just overnight but would have loved to stay longer. Had a harbor front room with views of the boats docked there. And fishing boats going in and out. It was an easy walk to downtown. There were several restaurants very close and others a short walk over the boardwalk. Will return.
reviews.title: Great location
Now Where Better
reviews.text: Our second year vwith the Brown's, no one has a better handle on how to operate a resort hotel than these folks. From the check-in desk to housekeeping, they leave nothing to want for.

reviews.title: great location, great value
reviews.text: The room rates are competitive and the views are breath-taking.

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.text: Having stayed in resorts in over half the world this is one of our favorites.

reviews.title: Terrific...
reviews.text: See you next June.

reviews.title: Loved everything about Brown's Wharf
reviews.text: Bob & Jane

description: AAA 3 diamond Inn with rooms and restaurant located directly over the ocean on beautiful Boothbay Harbor. All rooms have balconies and a commanding view of the harbor, the ocean and boating activities. Cable TV, telephone, refrigerators, ironers, Wi-Fi, use of computer, park and lock parking. Restaurant has been owned and operated by the Brown Family for the past 64 years, offering a full menu but specializing in local fresh seafood. Inside-outside dining with beautiful sunsets.
